intro: Pavetta mangallana, commonly known as the Malabar pavetta, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub, reaching heights of up to 2 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, glossy, and arranged alternately along the stems. The flowers are small, white or pale pink, and are clustered in terminal or axillary inflorescences.
